title: Oil steady on trade pact optimism, stock draw; eyes on MidEast
text: Oil prices hovered around three-month highs on Monday following a higher-than-expected crude inventory drawdown and optimism over an expected U.S-China trade deal, while traders kept a close eye on Middle East unrest.

title: Asian shares down from 18-month top; oil steady after U.S. strikes
text: A broad gauge of Asian share markets fell on Monday as investors consolidated gains after scaling 18-month highs last week, while oil was steady after the U.S. carried out air strikes on an Iranian-backed Shi’ite Muslim militia group in Iraq and Syria.

title: Chinese stocks decline in early trade; Hong Kong awaits trade data for November
text: Monday’s session in Asia follows fresh record highs in U.S. stocks last week amid year-end optimism in markets.

title: A 10% to 20% pullback could strike stocks early next year, long-time bull Ed Yardeni warns
text: Market bull Edward Yardeni is questioning the stamina of the market's win streak.

title: New Highs As The Dow, S&P And Nasdaq Parabolic Bubbles Continue To Inflate
text: If the December 31 market closes are little changed from the December 27 closes, these will be your risks/rewards for 2020.

title: Large Cap Stocks: Bull Horns
text: In this post, I’ll make an observation that shows how simple investing can be.

title: 2020: Global Economic Growth - Let It Rip!
text: Last week, we discussed how bearish all the market pundits/experts were last December for 2019 while the economic forecasters were optimistic.

title: China commerce ministry says it has proactively dealt with U.S. trade frictions
text: China's Commerce Ministry has "proactively dealt with" trade frictions with the United States this year, it said on Sunday after an annual work conference.

title: Investors Warned To Expect Global Dietary Shift Amid Climate Crisis
text: PRI warns investors that a policy response to the climate crisis is inevitable, has not yet been priced into markets, and will prove more disruptive the longer policymakers wait.
